Comments: 137 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I had a pair from this headphone line in the past, and used them until they basically fell apart (one side stopped working, and the cushioning material for the ears eventually peeled away.) And yet after trying myriad other brands, I rate these as my personal best. After my first pair died (took several years of daily use), I went on a quest to try a bunch of different headphones. After wasting hundreds of dollars over the past couple years on everything from fancy $200 pairs, cheap Amazon-branded pairs, and plenty of random ones from places like Big Lots or Walmart, I finally just came back to these for a meager $15. There's simply no beating the combination of comfort (especially for people with glasses!), sound quality, and price. I work in front of a computer for hours at a time, and almost always have headphones (and eye glasses) on. I probably have a larger than average head shape too. Every single other pair I have tried ended up making my ears hurt before long, except this one. While the construction quality is decent, I do expect to run through a new pair every couple years, but at this price point, it's really hard to complain. In summary, I am so thankful these are back in my life.
Title: By Far The Most Comfortable, Especially With Glasses

Comments: 60 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These are great headphones for music and movies for the price. I have never owned a big-money pair of headphones & after buying cheap ones that I had to replace multiple times due to breakage, I decided to get these after a recommendation from a friend. After buying them for myself, I also bought them for each of my kids. They're great for average use... i've never been bothered by outside noise, they are comfortable, and the sound is of good quality. They also are much sturdier than the cheapie $10-$20 ones I've gotten before. (My kids haven't broken them, which is a minor miracle)

I do recommend getting a bag or carrying case for them (I use a Crown Royal bag:) it certainly helps protect them and they do seem vulnerable at the hinges where they collapse for storage.

The only thing my kid complains about is the wire is kind of short. I prefer it because the wire is nice and thick and never gets tangled. with my previous cheap ones, it was always the wires that were delicate & one or both ears would go out. These are so much sturdier. (I think he just finds them too short when he wants to sit in the recliner with his iPad on the table & watch his Minecraft. If you don't require your headphones to meet these specific and ridiculous needs, the length should be fine.)
Title: Great headphones for average use, wires seem very sturdy & never get tangled

Comments: 23 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: When I first tried these on, I found them a bit uncomfortable. My over-ear phones are much more comfortable. But, I plugged these in and listened (I'm a guitar player and spend a lot of time listening to musical details. The sound was amazing! At first I thought I wouldn't like these, but the sound came out and I was blown away. I can't believe $15 headphones sound this good. I bought these as backups to my AT over-ears and wasn't expecting much but these are really really great. The only reason I didn't give five stars is because they are a tiny bit uncomfortable.
Title: My over-ear phones are much more comfortable. But

Title: Amazon is superior by far.

Comments: 4 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These headphones are great! I'm not an audiophile, so I can't really tell you how the sound compares, but they sound fine to me. I was more impressed with how long they lasted. I took these on several flights, had them in my overstuffed bags, dropped them and generally abused them. Unlike all other headphones I've had (which generally last me 3-6 months), these lasted 2 years! They got caught in my work chair and the pin was bent when I stood up, otherwise I think they might still be going. Since I will be traveling in a few weeks, I've already decided to purchase the noice-cancelling Sony's for a bit more.
The downside to these headphones (and reason I gave them 4 instead of 5 stars) is that the cord is a bit long and would get stuck between chairs, desks, etc (which is what eventually led to their demise). The cord was different which was good because it didn't seem to get tangled so often but bad because I think that's also why they were constantly getting caught in things. Lastly, I like headphones to fit snugly, these were lighter weight (which I don't like as much) and weren't so snug-fitting. Probably better for people with larger heads.
Title: Great Headphones! Lasted me 2 years!

Comments: 11 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I got these for $7.99 on a lightning deal. They are excellent for the price. I ordered two pair: one for my 3 year old and one as a travel pair of headphones. The sound quality is impressive for the price. These are on the ear headphones, not over the ear. So, passive noise isolation won't be as good. However, they are quite comfortable. I could easily wear these for a couple hours while watching a movie. The physical size of the headphones make them a good choice for children. Sure, they aren't brightly colored, but I'm willing to bet the sound quality and price are much better than you'd pay for a branded set of crappy headphones. Also, I was surprised at the quality of the cord. I was expecting a thin, cheap cord. It's actually fairly thick and tangle resistant. Only complaint I have -- I wish the cord connected at a single point, rather than running to each ear piece. But, again, for the price they're darn good quality.

Update: I've now used these headphones several times on the treadmill. I like them even more now. When running, you'll occasionally run into a set of headphones with a seriously flimsy cord. As you run, a flimsy cord will bounce and become seriously annoying. These don't do that at all. I love how the solid cord just hangs with minimal movement. Also, the ear pads will get a bit sweaty, but nothing a quick wipe won't rectify. I'll let you know how they hold up for exercise use.
Title: Terrific Budget Headphones

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)

The material quality is also ok, I read a lot of reviews stating that these broke almost immediately, and though they are not sturdy or particularly well built they should last a good amount of time provided they are not mistreated. I give these five stars mainly because of the price.

Title: Decent, for the price. :)

Comments: 398 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
WOW - Picked these up today after wearing the ZX100 for the last 3 years and wearing through the lining on the padding.

Sounds is incredible, rich bass, not 'deep' as Bose/Beats might sell you, just a solid, full, well balanced sound, much better than I expected from a $20 pair of phones. Looking at the cost difference between the '100's and these, the $5 is laughable.

Feel is fantastic, quality materials, folding pads is awesome and a thick cable with the right angle connector makes life easy. Tug to hard one way? Pressure gets pushed into the wire connection, not the actual plug which (one of my favorite, and most often utilized features of the 100s) so they won't snap on you.

Cost, well, if you can't shell out $20 for a decent pair of headphones it might be worth spending that money elsewhere.

Very happy, terrific product and price point. Blown away!
Title: much better than I expected from a $20 pair of phones

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These phones sound really nice, for being under $20. I have owned at least 30 different headphones since 1974, and these sound as good as any of the $100 Sennheisers I had back when Elton John's "Rocket Man" was new music. The power requirement for the voice coils in these phones is remarkably low: They sound great for listening to music on a cell phone or tablet, and you won't even have to crank the volume up to maximum. Some of the headphones I have owned recently don't work well with mobile devices, requiring more output power than the audio chip in a cell phone can provide - that won't be a problem with these Sony ZX-110 phones. They sound just fine on my Samsung Galaxy Tab S at 50% of max volume. Frequency response is very good for economy priced phones, with clear treble and adequate bass response to let you "feel" the drums and bass guitar. Soprano and contralto vocals sound nice and clear, without that "muddy" sound that cheap phones give that don't have enough high-frequency response. These phones fold up into a very small, compact footprint that is easy to store in a medium or large purse, or any briefcase, backpack, or laptop computer bag. The cord is 3 feet, and has a 90° angled plug. This cord length is great for use with a cell phone in a shirt pocket, although not really long enough for home use with a desktop computer. If you are going to use these phones to listen to music on a home stereo or desktop computer, you will need an extension cord, but these aren't terribly expensive.
COMFORT: Sony got this right: these phones grip your head just firmly enough to stay in place, without squeezing you to death. I have had a couple of Sony phones that were horrible in this respect, with way too much compression on an average sized head; that's not a problem with these phones. The ear pads are very comfortable, and they don't press hard enough on your earlobes to make you need to take your earrings off to use the phones.

SUMMARY: A Typical Sony economy-priced headphone with much better sound than you might have expected at this price point. Folds up very small for carrying in a purse or laptop computer bag, Very comfortable to wear for up to several hours.

PRODUCT RECOMMENDATION: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
Title: Typical Sony MDR headphones - very affordable price, sound great, comfortable to wear, excellent value for your money.

Reviews:
The package had already been opened, the manufacturer's tape/seal was cut in one area and the box looked to have been bent in that area to allow for the product to be taken out.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I need several sets of fairly compact folding headphones with decent sound and a good price, so ordered these along with two others to try out (the JVC HAS160A and the Panasonic RP-HX40-G.) Having used Sony products in the past, I expected these to outperform the others, but they didn't. The sound isn't as loud as the others, and it's fairly muffled, not clear. Clarity is important in my application (hard of hearing assistance), but even for casual music listening, these would be disappointing. I tried them on a small battery player and a more powerful Yamaha mixer, but couldn't tell a difference in the sound quality, just more volume on the mixer.
On the plus side, they have a little better bass than the others, and are probably more comfortable to wear for long periods (I only tried them for about a half hour.) And they look more impressive, being quite a bit more bulky.

Title: World's Okayest Headphones

Comments: 251 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
In this household, we care a lot about sound quality. We're spoiled with great 2 channel stereos. For headphones I listen to Grado headphones, at least until they finally broke down. Recently we found ourselves surrounded by headphones.

So, in a headphone shootout here at home, two kids, two adults we came to this conclusion.

$200 Beats (paid $70 black Friday sale price): 1/4 picked as fav. (the teen)
$120 Bose: 1/4 picked as fav. (the mom)
$10 Sony: 2/4 picked as fav. (the audiophiles, dad and 10 year old)
$20 Apple earbuds 0/4 picked as fav. (universally hated)

We listened to uncompressed rock over an iPod shuffle, or Youtube.

These "giant killer" Sony phones have a clear, detailed, open sound. Meaning that the music don't sound cluttered between your ears, it seems to extend to around your head. Bass has real detail: you can hear the note, the reverb and the string pluck. For bass, these beat the Bose and Beats, with ease. Also, unlike Beats, you can actually hear people talk to you when you have these on. Not everybody in my family thought these were the best sounding though, my wife preferred the Bose.

The low point: they aren't as super comfortable as the Bose. Everybody agrees the Bose are the super comfy pair. Technically, these were not the loudest, but they were plenty loud enough!
Title: mini-shootout winners

Title: I am very pleased with my purchase

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I bought this for my electric/digital piano (Korg), as I live below my landlord, and cant play over my amp. Not used to headphones, and liking the sound of the amp, I thought of this as an experiment. With budget being at the forefront of my mind in this experiment and with many expenses related to a move, I gave it a try, and to my surprise, am pretty impressed with them. What I was thinking, that the 'directness' of playing thru an amp' would not be equaled by a headphone, is actually not the case; the headphone puts me more in my piano world, to the exclusion of anything else, and in that way makes it even more direct.You cant really sing along with it but I knew I had to forego that with the landlord above me, so I do that elsewhere. Instead I focus on the piano parts. I chose this head-phone for the extra bass, as I like to hear the deep piano bass sounds akin to a grand, and it does deliver in that range as well. Considering the budget, and knowing there are probably better and way more expensive professional phones out there, I 'm very happy with this purchase.
Title: Delivers on electric piano !

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Comfortable for extended use even though I have a larger sized head.
Sound is good and balanced for such a bargain price set of head phones.
Not bass heavy nor too bright with the highs, just a slightly over emphasized mind range.
So adjust the EQ on your player to suite your own taste. I set mine to boost the bass and treble.

Just don't expect audiophile quality from a $15 set of headphones and you will love these!
I use mine for listening to music on an ipod while landscaping and using power tools.
Perfect! No worries about spoiling an expensive set of headphones.

One caveat: volume levels are fine with my MP3 player or Tablet, but when used with my desktop computer
the volume levels are low. It maybe my computer set-up or sound card (ASUS Xonar DGX), but all my other
earbuds & headphones have good volume levels when used with the same computer. No problem for me
as I only use mine for listening to music on an ipod while landscaping and working with louder power tools.

Edit: 11/10/2015:
I found some settings in the Asus Xonar DGX sound card software that amplified the signal if using higher impedance headphones, so now I have good volume levels when using my computer as a source.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Works great if you do not need noise canceling & the price is great.
This is not a noise canceling headphone but the outside noise is dimmed - even more so while listening to scriptures, or teachings - sometimes when there is a pause, you can hear dimly the outside noise/talking/TV, etc.- depends a great deal on how loud the outside sounds are.
But for my basic needs, these work great.
The ear part does go Over your ear but I have not felt any added heat like some I have tried.
The band can be adjusted and I have not had problems with my reading glasses while using these headphones.
The USB cord is approximately 3 feet long and the ear plugs fold up for easy story.

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I bought these headphones because my other pair of headphones, made by a different company, broke. When I received the headphones I wasn't that impressed, but then again these are $20 headphones. When I plugged it into my MP3 player I could barely hear my music unless I nearly maxed out the volume. My gummy earbuds have better sound quality than these. If I could, I'd return them but instead I bought a pair of Monster headphones and will keep these as a backup. As for the mic, it's pretty decent. When I first used it however, the other person on the phone kept complaining that they could not hear me. But now I think it is okay.
Title: Not what I expected...

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These headphones exceed their price in quality. I'm not an audiophile but I do know a thing or two. I used these Sony Extra Bass 110APs with an iPhone 6 playing 320kbps MP3s as well as a PS4 playing Destiny for voice chat and game sounds. The sound is very balanced and crisp for folk, country, rock, and punk with adequate bass for hip hop and EDM. More on gaming later.

I have a very large head, 7 3/4 hat size. These are just fine. They are very light and the headband extends beyond my needs.

I do not like noise canceling in any form as it contributes to artificial characteristics and I like being able to hear cars and pedestrians as I walk around the city. These headphones are great if you share my tastes. I wear these on the bus to and from work every day and while walking around downtown. The volume and audio mix blend well with ambience and they are light and fold up well into my bag.

For PS4/Destiny the sound was adequate but not particularly engaging. Voice audio was great and my friends reported my voice sounded better than the PS-VITA earbuds as well as the PS4-included chat earbud. The bass was underwhelming for game audio, however. Everything was crisp and detailed but I wanted more bass for explosions and gunfire.

To summarize, these are great for an iPhone commute but only fair for PS4/Destiny.
Title: Great for the commute. Fine on big heads. Adequate for PS4. Quality exceeds price.

You would have to buy something to split it separately.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Whenever I buy headphones, I make sure to buy the ones that go over the ear because I wear mine usually over the course of a couple hours per session. On-ear was a really bad idea, especially at the default configuration (I have a small head, I didn't bother changing the configuration because any bigger I thought it might slip). After about 20 minutes of wearing the headphones at the default configuration my ears started to ache and hurt, I couldn't spend too much time with them.

However, the sound that comes out of these beauties is absolutely amazing! Excellent resounding bass, not sub-woofer quality but a close second. The treble is very balanced, I can crank these up to high than I usually have and not have to worry about sharp cracks due to the audio track peaking at kicks and snare hits. On previous over-ear headphones the max i could set my overall volume was 25%, which at the time was good enough to hear just about everything. With these I can crank them past 50% and more and not have to worry about any sharp cracks. Truly a good pair of headphones for the price.

Regarding the tightness i felt earlier, I was able to adjust the length to fit my needs. The tightness lessened to the point I was able to wear them for extended periods of time, the pads are very much comfortable even if they appear thin. I still prefer over-ear headphones, which denotes the 4 star. That's just my bias.

These headphones are fold-able to fit comfortable and compactly in medium sized pockets or carrying slots. They will almost never tangle, as noted by the semi-circle shaped cords. Although when you first get them, it might take a while to straighten out the curls. Nice strong and thick cable. Lastly, regarding external noise. Most of the noise is largely contained within the headphones, at least within my experience.

[I'll post some pictures later to emphasize my points, although there are a good number of reviews that already showcase this.]
Title: Expected Over-ear, got On-Ear

Title: awesome headphone and look nice too

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
This is a good pair of inexpensive headphones. They are durable. I have bought both the black and white models - just not for myself. I prefer the white ones since they are easier to find in clutter. These can not touch my SONY V6 headphones, not even close. Of course, I don't want anyone to touch my SONY V6 headphones so these fill that gap nicely. After more than two years of use I was surprised that these did not fall apart. These are not that comfortable but that's not the point, these are nice for being $20. In this same price range I paid more than this for ear bud headphones, all of which fell apart. Most of my ear-bud headphones suffered the same fate of having their cables break on the inside.

it's not fare to compare these to more expensive headphones. If you are buying these for yourself and can afford it, of course get better ones.
Title: Durable, nice for $20. Saved me money.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: These are perfect for me. I have small ears so the ear plugs most people use don't work for me. These fit nicely and are adjustable. The sound is good, even at ear popping volume. I haven't had a need to use the microphone yet, but I like having the option. There is no way you can use these for sports, but that is not their purpose, so I'm okay with that. I use them mainly to listen to my Amazon prime music on the iPad. Overall, I would say these are an excellent value. I would definitely buy them again if something happens to the current pair.
Title: Good sound and great value

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Overal this was a good purchase—until they broke only after a few months. for no apparent reason. The sound qaulity is great for the price but the durability of these headphones is very questionable did not expect this from Sony. I have had headphones from other brands for around the same price or cheaper and they have lasted a lot longer.
Title: Good sound, horrible durability.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Mediocre Headphones. From the first day they kept acting up: slight and I mean SLIGHT pressure on the cord (specifically the L shaped part that plugs into your device), will cause songs to skip or pause. Doing that will also activate Google Voice for some odd reason. Imagine listening to your favorite song just to have it be interrupted by Google Voice 30 times, or have it skip to the next song before your favorite part comes on. I’ve purchased headphones from Sony in the past and I’m surprised that I received such a disappointing product.
Title: Mediocre Headphones

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: The sound may not be as good as a sennheiser HD 202, but it sure can last longer. I bought these for my brother and it's been going strong ever since. My bro plays a lot of basketball so these headphones get exposed to a lot of heat and sweat. However, my sennheiser hd202, which I bought with these sonys, is losing sound on the left speaker. I didn't even use my hd202s that often.sony makes better headphones than sennheiser.
Title: Sony is bettet than sennheiser

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Don't let the price fool you, these headphones are in fact great! From deep house music to crunchy blues/jazz rock music, they deliver a good experience, and are awesome value for money for 15 bucks. The only issue I have is sound leakage - if you try to turn up the volume, people around you can hear a little bit and it might not be great in an office environment, but I guess you would have to go as high as at least 50% on the volume levels for noticeable leakage. Have had them for a week now and loving the experience.
Title: these headphones are in fact great! From deep house music to crunchy blues/jazz rock ...

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: These are great headphones. The sounds quality is ok, they aren't really noise cancelling but my husband loves them. We had a different pair that were very expensive and they broke after a few months. These have lasted a while now. The rope is thick and strong and we haven't had any breaking or anything like that which often happens. The ear pieces are comfortable to wear for extended listening time. I would really recommend and buy again.
Title: good quality for price

Comments: 5 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I bought these headphones after reading various reviews and can fully endorse what other people have found. The sound from these has a very rich bass without compromising the higher end frequencies. They perform much better than the price suggest...they certainly aren't cheap and nasty in their sound quality. They seem to be really good at blocking out external sounds, and I'll be up-dating when I've been on a plane journey which is why, for now I've obly given 4 stars. With good sound deadening on a plane, I'll be up-dating to 5 stars. I'd recommend these to anyone except, obviously, those who are only concerned with being seen with some hugely expensive trendy brands of headphones which, in my experience, have worse higher frequency response at increased volumes.
Title: An affordable gem from Sony

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: The shipping was very fast and the audio is very good quality. The cord doesn't get easily tangled. And something that I didn't notice in the pictures (maybe it was in the description), is that the audio jack is the kind that is at a right angle, making it seem far more durable and long lasting. And I can appreciate that since my other headphones had retired after one or two years because the audio jack had gotten askew or even broken off after one fatal fall. My only concern is the joint where the headphone swivels because it feels a bit delicate but it has been holding up pretty well. For the price, I am beyond satisfied.
Title: Great Quality for Price

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I love these. Great sound, very affordable, and super easy to use. I travel with these all over the world (they are very compact and fit into a nice zip bag). Comfortable (I usually have issues with headphones -- very sensitive ears). I even sleep with them lying down on the plane (in business). Sometimes they get a bit sweaty when I use them to work out in, but I just wipe them off with wet paper towel.
Title: Love these headphones!

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I bought these for my son and he loves them. They are comfortable with clear sound and "great bass". He especially likes that they fold easily and I love that they have survived being beaten up and abused in his backpack and are still going strong after three months.
Title: They are comfortable with clear sound and "great bass"

Comments: 6 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I read a LOT of reviews before making this purchase and I REALLY wanted to love these headphones.. I mean, they're Sony's! I was looking for high quality Bass headphones. Sadly, these are not as good as my husband's Kanen i35 Headphones that he bought here on Amazon for under $20. First of all, they have a much looser fit than the Kanen's, so you can easily hear noise around you, preventing a fully enclosed feeling when it comes to listening to my music. The bass quality was also inferior to the Kanen's. I listened to a nice high, bass song like M83's "Midnight City and did a side-by-side comparison of the headphones and clearly, Kanen's sound came through very loud, clear and with a fuller bass. Had to make sure to share my experience so hopefully it will help someone out when they are trying to make a purchase decision. Good luck!
Title: ... before making this purchase and I REALLY wanted to love these headphones

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I really liked the price to sound quality ratio of these headphones HOWEVER the jack is very flimsy. I broke my first pair sitting down with my phone in my pocket. The jack bent, and from then on I had to hold the cord at a particular angle to get sound in both ears. I assumed the fault was mine and bought a second pair, but within a week the cord got caught on a doorknob I was walking past, and with very little force, the jack snapped right in half, leaving the metal part in my phone. I don't think I can afford to keep replacing these every month.
Title: Good sound, but too flimsy.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: This is a really nice set of headphones for the money. I've never been able to get accustomed to those small earbuds most people use. After a few minutes they make my ears sore. I travel alot also, so I need headphones that will cancel some of the noise from the loudness of the airplane. I'm sure a big set of "noise cancelling" headphones would work a bit better in this regard, but for what they are, this set seems to do a fairly adeqaute job. The sound is really good, they are comfortable, and I absolutley love the "fold up" feature this model has to offer. These headphones will easily fold up, taking up minimal space in your carry on luggage. Glad I purchased!
Title: Great Sound, Compact, Comfortable!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Great sound quality , comfort, and volume. I have had these before and after 5 or more years they wore out from cleaning the pads.
Great Price and just bought 2 more. The only con you might find is the core is 4 feet. I have had a 8 foot extension for years so it doesn't bother me. Excellent purchase.
Title: Try these you will like them.,

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I was looking for something to replace my Sennheiser HD 201’s, the connection of which broke on one ear. I first tried the Sentey Warps based on all the glowing reviews, but the inadequate bass response deprived the music of real presence for me. These inexpensive Sony’s did not disappoint. The sounds are clear and smooth with reasonably good definition in all frequency ranges. The emphasized bass lets you feel the music without becoming overwhelming. Having said that I should point out that the higher frequencies and even some of the mids are more recessed as compared to other headphones that I own. That may bother some audiophiles. Nonetheless, I am very happy with my purchase – especially at this price point. I like the fact that I will be able to use them with my Android phone. Since these are worn on the ear and not over the ear, they do leak sound so they probably aren't the best for an airplane or other situations where others are nearby.
Title: Pleasing sound at a great price

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Sony's headphones never cease to amaze me. My last Sony MDRZX100 headphones (The older variant of these headphones) broke in one ear cup after using for a year and a half everyday. For only paying $35 for those headphones at the time, I opted to get this pair of newer and cheaper headphones. The sound is crisp, bass is rich, and mid-tones can be heard amazingly! For only $20, I got an extreme upgrade from the previous headphones. Sony is an amazing company to get cheap headphones for a GREAT PRICE!
Title: Upgraded my Older Headphones to These AMAZING BEASTS!

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I bought these due to how often I need a headset on my laptop and phone. I actively used these (two different pair) for a few years.
During that time period I learned that the headset is HIGHLY prone to shorting out on one side. Sometimes the mic doesn't work after a good while of use. Sound quality isn't too great but the folding mechanism is wonderful for storage whether it's in a purse, backpack or just on your lap while you're waiting somewhere.
For the price-- if you need something fairly quick and don't mind replacing them often and are *only* needing them for your phone or light computer work-- I think this is okay. If you'd like better quality for voice and sound-- I wouldn't recommend these at all. If you'd like a product that's going to last over a year-- don't. Go look somewhere else and invest a little more money. I expect these to last for six months with heavy use.

Title: Great Headphones

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I got this for $7.99 during the holiday season. I don't recall if these were a lightning deal or just a general sale but I guess that doesn't really matter much. I gotta say, they perform better than expected. I am by no means an expert on headphone-quality, but I know what I like and I like these headphones. They are sturdy and they sound great. I use them almost daily at work (going on two months now!) with no problems.

They may not be the fanciest headphones out there but if you just need a simple headphone set for casual use, you could do a lot worse than these.
Title: They're not fancy but I like 'em.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These are just great for the price and then some. I bought these to replace the costco headphones that are battery assisted and where like 60 bucks. So those 60 dollar headphones broke at the dang cord, and cannot be replaced. This cord is the best you can buy and likely wont break the same way as it is protected and flexable.

Sound quality is awesome. The battery assisted ones could go a little louder, but after listening for hours like I usually do, my ears were sore. This is great sound right to the point where it is dangerous, but not hitting that line.

Very comfortable as well and very light. Dr. Dre can kiss it, I'm fine just using these great headphones, crazy good. Will buy a couple more and store them for gifts and extras.
Title: Mc Luvin it!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I love these headphones. One has to look at their use type to determine their needs of course, but for likely 90% of people the goal is sound quality, comfort and reliability for the money and these Sony's really are fantastic for the price I paid ($20). I use these everywhere, including at the gym where they stay in place better than many earpiece units I've tried, on my mp3 player, tablet or computer for music or tv/movie watching, for audio books and for phone use. There is a slightly cheaper version of these that don't have the microphone but for hands free talk from my phone I can hear those I speak to very well and I also am told I can be heard well too. True these headphones don't have quite the ear hugging pads of some of the higher priced noise cancelling one's but they are still very good at blocking sound and are quite comfortable. These also have good extension for different sized noggins and while lightweight, they feel sturdy and well crafted. My kid has $200 Beats which take less abuse than my Sony's and in less than 3 months hers are already having sound issues while mine keep playing great. I'll be buying another pair of these just to put away, that's how much I like them.
Title: Sony quality, great sound, a real value.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
My ears are very sensitive to the touch with any headphone, and ear buds usually do not stay in my ears, and if I can even get them in, they are quite painful, even long after taking them out. Most low-priced over the head ear phones are also uncomfortable on my head and ears, and the older ones never sounded good.
I've only used these once for a couple of hours, so I can not comment on how long they last. If things change, I will amend my review. With these, the sound was clear, left and right separated well, and did not press too hard on my ear. When I took them off after a couple of hours of use, my head around my ears was slightly sore/sensitive, but that did not last longer than 5 minutes. As I said, that area of my head is quite sensitive.
For $15 I highly recommend these.
Title: they are quite painful, even long after taking them out

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I got these for under 8 dollars, so I wasn't expecting much. They turned out to be a good set of headphones. The sound quality is good. They are comfortable on the head and ears. The only minor complaint is the person sitting next to you can hear everything if the volume is turned up. And since one of the main reasons you wear headphones is to not bother anyone with your noise, it loses one star. The cord is short, but if you use them with your phone or laptop, it works out perfect. I bought these for a TV, so I might have to buy and extension. All in all, I would definitely recommend these.
Title: Good Quality, Low Price!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
First and foremost these are great headphones, especially for under $20.

I'm not an audiophile by any means, rather a fairly regular guy looking for a pair of headphones on a budget that will still do a good job delivering great sound quality. These are absolutely the headphones that will do that. Sound quality is excellent from fountains of Wayne's "Stacies Mom" to childish gambino's "Oakland." Comfort wise the headphones are also excellent, there is no pinch, they're very lightweight, and the ear cups are very comfortable.

The only reason I give these headphones 4 stars is the build materials. Because they are a low cost headphone they are made of a fairly run of the mill plastic, along with that the swivel design is something that I can forsee breaking in the future, it's not flimsy, rather just the mechanism is of it puts a pretty good deal of torque on a fairly small joint.

If you're looking for a pair of new headphones buy these. For the price they can't be matched, just remember you're buying them for less than $20 so don't expect any thing too crazy in the build materials and quality
Title: Excellent Budget Headphone, Not Perfect, But Worth It

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Bought these to replace a slightly more expensive pair of headphones I bought a few years back. The sound quality is comparable. They are made pretty well for the price, and the chord is especially well made. Decent to above average sound quality for the price. If you're looking for an inexpensive pair of headphones to binge watch Netflix or Hulu with, you can't go wrong. Just got them today, and thus far, I'm very happy! Something else that has nothing to do with quality. I'm legally blind, and have trouble seeing the little L and R written on the headphones to distinguish the left phone from the right. Well, the left phone has a tiny little bump on it that I can feel that the right does not. I have no idea if this was done intentionally, but it is EXTREMELY helpful to me.

Comments: 5 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Sony's for only $17? I thought-what a great deal! They're even well rated. I'm not sure by who though. The sound quality was just meh, and let it be said that these are ON EAR headphones. After 15 minutes I had to take them off because my ears hurt so bad. While wearing them the foam in the ear pads makes a crunching noise every time you move your jaw or facial muscles. They only fold up minimally, and they also don't come with a carrying bag or case (which for $17 is kind of expected.) If you're looking for on-ear headphones you should probably keep looking for something more comfortable.

Newer version for less amount of money. The only drawback is, if you have a desktop computer the cord isn't quite long enough. Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I am extremely pleased with this headset. I bought it for two main purposes, listening to music on an iPad and plugging into a headphone amp while I practice what I laughingly call my guitar playing. The headphones excel at both, sounding much better than the admittedly good iPad speaker and faithfully reproducing the guitar's tones. (Though that last isn't always doing me any favors.) The headphones sound every bit as good as my gaming headsets costing four times as much. The bass is strong without being overpowering or artificial or distorted, midrange and treble are equally pure and balanced.

One issue that is a plus for me but maybe not you - the cord is very short. Great for iPad and guitar, not so much for gaming or work.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
The set we had broke after two months; the swiveling joint on the LH earpiece/speaker came apart on one side. I fixed it; just needed to find the small metal pin, reinsert it into the joint and screw everything back together. Unfortunately, it promptly broke again, so apparently ours was defective. I have been working with Sony Customer Service (not always an easy proposition- let's just say English is not the first language of their mostly otherwise helpful and courteous CS representatives) to get a replacement under the 90-day warranty. Had to call them twice in two weeks, then had to send the defective ones back at my expense to Sony. Quite frankly, not a stellar experience, there...
The design of the swiveling speakers is neat, and when it works, convenient for storage. Don't know if the issue we experienced is widespread or not. The headphones' electronics worked fine, and before we had the problem with the swivel joint coming apart, my daughter really loved them.

assumes you are using an mp3 player. Overall I am quite pleased with the quality & value

Reviews: Sounds quality is good on these, but be aware they are NOT loud. I wore them while using my airbrush with a very small, not terribly loud compressor and found it mostly drowned out the sound (cranked to full volume), which had never been a problem with most ear buds. I then tried to use then while mowing, and after attempting 4 different mp3s, had to give up and switch back to my old ear buds that came with a phone or tablet or something. I'd consider returning them, but they were like10 bucks, so I'll keep them for sitting at the computer and such, but I am disappointed.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: The sound is okay on these, which was expected- they are $15. I didn't expect fantastic sound. However, I was upset because the comparison chart said the headphones would be over the ear headphones and I definitely received on-ear headphones. I feel like that was really misleading and should be corrected. I originally got these headphones because of the great reviews and I was sick of the headphone jacks on my dollar stores headphones. I can honestly say that the jack on these headphones is even WORSE than dollar store headphones. If I move even the tiniest bit, and even when I haven't moved at all, the sound will come out of the laptop speakers instead of the headphones. I willing to put up with the fact that these are on-ear, but the jack is annoying me so much that I was moved to write a review. I never write reviews. I thought I was making a better investment with these headphones, but honestly I'd rather stick with the dollar store ones. I am extremely disappointed with these- do your research before you by them instead of being blindsided by the good reviews.
Title: Terrible jack, misleading comparison chart

Title: Good quality for the price

Comments: 7 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I was curious if there was a difference between these and a "higher class" set of headphones so I purchased these along side the
$70 Audio-Technica ATH-M30x. I first tried these Sony headphones on and was quite pleased. Nice bass response and good overall sound. I was satisfied.

But then I tried the ATH-M30x and noticed the difference immediately. These had much better dynamic range. The highs where a lot brighter and the lows were even lower and more defined. Most importantly the mid range (voices) sound much much clearer.

I tried these Sony headphones again and they sounded pretty bad now. I could really hear how bad the voices seemed muffled and all the treble I was missing.

I'm not suggesting to get the ATH-M30x, as I'm not sure if I'll keep those either (now I'm curious about a higher class headphones). I'm just saying when you compare the Sony's to other headphones they are actually not that good.
Title: You get what you pay for

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Good service by amazon. Item not damage during shipping. Item arrive mint in condition. Sound and voice quality is good. Great sony product with a good price point. Recommeded by my friend. But the downside is the wire is a bit fragile. The 2 wires below the the 2 ear cups on each side. If you set the headset down resting on those 2 cable connection to the ear cup. The wires will be easily damage. The weight of the headphone will be pressing down on the thin wire connection causing some static to the headset. Can be fix if you know how to open it and straighten the wire back. Got to be very careful how you set the headphone down. It's a Android headphone. If you want to use it with a PC, need to buy a audio mic splitter adapter like the creative had.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I hate these headphones They are not NEARLY as good as the previous version that Sony is obsolescing, the Sony MDRZX100. Here's how Sony is cheaping out in the new design:

1. no strain relief at wire and ear cap -- more likely to break, i.e. crappier
2. plastic design of housing is molded to be more lighter and more hollow, i.e. weaker and crappier
3. new hinging design seems to be quite weak, less smooth and more shear-y (it's this weird, crappy plastic-om-plastic bearing), gives the tactile feel of crappier quality.
4. wires to aux have a thinner casing -- i.e. are crappier

Darnit, Sony, stop cheaping out and obsolescing the old design.
Title: Cheap compared to previous design, optimized to make Sony money, but not to impress customer base.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I have this headphones permanently plugged to my computer at my office. I use a switcher to alternate between headphones and speakers whenever I need to keep the sound to myself. I work on video editing, so I use these ALL the time. After almost two years they are still going strong with nice and crisp sound. I do not hear any distortion or buzzing. It's true what other reviewers mention, they feel a little cheap, but guess what? They are! I bought them fully knowing that they would be everyday working headphones and not leisure or audiophile ones, for that I spent a lot more money and got much better sounding quality. Even so, I took them home a few nights ago (I used a good case protector) to use while at bed and while I could clearly hear the difference between this pair and the good ones, I could still listen to my tunes without issue. They stay on my head at all times.

For $15 these are as good as it gets. Totally recommend them. If they break it is absolutely worth it to buy a new pair, the newer model even has a microphone for less than what I paid originally.
Title: Great office headphones

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
It's not bad for the price, but has some pretty bad sound leak at higher volumes, and what is this quality?

The photo attached is HOW THE HEADPHONES CAME IN. This kind of build quality is not okay, that is what I would expect from a used pair of headphones, not from a new pair.

Pros:
- Easy to use
- Comfortable to wear
- Folds up for easy storage

Cons:
- Single layer cable, is not braided
- Terrible QA, see my picture
- So-so build quality
- Leaks audio at higher volumes
- Shorter cable
- Presses on your ears

All in all, I guess I would buy it again, but maybe next time I'll give the MDRZX100 a shot because those were the ones that everyone was recommending, but I saw these and got these instead. I do believe these are cheaper than the older model though, so I'm not entirely sure.

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I'll start with the good things: they are a very good set of headphones (for the money). they have good sound quality for $20 headphones (the bass was a bit lacking but...). now let's talk about the bad things. they broke, and not in a "oh crap they snapped in half" kind of way. more like they just stopped working. it was most likely my fault and that's why i'm giving it a four star review but i still feel like they could have lasted longer. i mean sure they lasted awhile for the money but still SIX MONTHS. thats all i had them for. i already ordered a replacement that is ten times the price. the Logitech G933 Artemis Spectrum.

Reviews: I'm not an audio specialist but for my purposes, these on-ear headphones are great! I use them with my iPod, computer, etc. They're light weight and provide above average sound quality; especially at the higher ranges, where many other "economical" models sound shrill. This one doesn't, and the bass sounds great. I highly recommend them for anyone who can't use in-ear headphones or earbuds, especially for this price!

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These are actually pretty good. I've been using this style of headphones for years now, and I usually buy in this price range, as they tend to break after about a year from normal wear and tear. These are one of my favourites in my price range.

Some of the things I like are the soft ear pieces. I wear glasses so generally after a while my ears will start to ache when I use headphone. I can wear these much longer than most. The sound quality is good, although I wouldn't call them totally noise cancelling. The folding parts aren't amazing, but it saves a bit of space.

All in all a great pair for the price.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I gave it 5 stars because of the price and sound quality. If these cost $50 instead of $15 they would get maybe 2 or 3 stars. But with these I apply the 80/20 rule.....at 20% of the price of higher end headphones you still get 80% of the quality. With the 80/20 rule its the other 20% of quality that can really drive the price up :-)

Build Quality; Good enough, little cheapy/plasticy. The padded ear pieces are good enough, and the chord is a nice bonus as its thicker (less prone to damage and tangeling). One mark against them is I found the padding to be a little too much, making my ears a little warm after a couple hours. Some headphones have less padding and a more open design.

Sound; With brands like Bose and Beats I expect a bias in terms of sound profile (eg. too much hi/lo, too much bass, etc...). With the Sony's, the profile is pretty even from the low to mids to highs. Songs with heavier bass sounded fine, with the bass neither under or over emphasized. In terms of quality there's no noticeable distortion. Nice and clean.

If Sony built these with slightly better materials, and added more emphasis to the bass and treble, they could probably sell them for $50+. And, I'm sure they do.
Title: Great for the price.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: For what they are, they deserve 5 stars. I'm more of a habitual user of earbuds, but I wanted a set that I use specifically and only for around my house. For the longest time, I used one pair of earbuds for everything, which led to me constantly having to go to my car or back into the house to get them. For starters, these headphones are very well built! The wires are relatively thick, but not obtrusively so, and the plastic feels very rugged and durable. They are extremely comfortable. I was skeptical of their comfort level considering they don't fit over the entire ear, but the cushy pads work very well. I have no problem wearing these for hours. The sound quality is quite nice. Now I will admit that my buds have a little more sonic depth, but don't worry 13 year old boys- this has good bass, the most important musical quality for anyone under 16. The sound quality is, at most, 4 stars, but I didn't expect perfection (nor did I intend on using these for my music player). These are perfect for watching movies, shows, or YouTube. The fact that they fold up is just a fun little bonus. If you just need a set of headphones for generalized computer use, I can't see you doing wrong with these.
Title: Great budget pair

Comments: 3 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I have been buying this particular style of headphones from Sony for no less than 5 years. We are a family of ten with a lot of gadgets and gizmos that require headphones. Plus several youngins' who need headphones for school. This latest adaptation is slightly different from the original in that the cords are flat. Performance though continues to be outstanding. We only ever need to replace these because they've been lost. In the no less than 5 years we have been purchasing these we've purchased other "top quality" brands that just do not offer the sound quality or comfort that these do. Frankly, the price is always right and as long as the product is able to withstand a family that includes and bunch of little ones we will continue to purchase well into the future. You will not go wrong buying these Sony headphones.
Title: Simply the best

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These headphones are the definition of "bang for your buck." I actually own their predecessor, the MDR-ZX100. There is a little more bass than the 100s, but it's not going to blow you away. The cans do a good job of delivering music at high volumes with no distortion. The jack is more slender than the 100s, and should fit into most iPhone cases (fits into mine with no problem). The inline mic picks up my voice just fine, but note there are no volume controls. Just one button to wake up Siri or to pause music. The 110s also fold up a little more nicely than the 100s, and they will fit nicely in my backpack while laying flat.

I suppose if there is a drawback, it's that Sony used a glossy plastic for the exterior of the cans. That means you'll have fingerprints visible. But that's all I can think of as as drawback.

Overall, if you are looking for a replacement for an aging set, even if they are the 100s, I'd say go for it. If the inline mic is not something you think you'll use, there's a version without one that will save you a few bucks.
Title: Best Bang for Buck

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Headphones worked well with my Android smartphone (Droid Maxx) and tablet (Nexus 9). However, when I switched to the iPhone 6S, the smartphone started to engage Voice Control for no reason and with no physical intervention. The Voice Control would occur randomly whenever the headphone plug is rotated, which would occur if you were exercising or just moving around. I had the iPhone 6S replaced per Apple warranty, and the same symptoms occurred with the second iPhone 6S. I then used a different headphone on my iPhone 6S, and it worked fine.

So be wary on using this headphone on an iPhone with headphone jack...
Title: Had issues using headphone with iPhone 6S

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Just received these. I got them primarily for use on my computer, mostly just listening to videos but also to use with voice recognition software, so I got the one with the microphone..

I'm not an audiophile, but I did want decent sound in case I use them on a music player. They sound just fine, as you would expect from Sony, especially at this price point.

I'm quite happy that they work very well with Dragon NaturallySpeaking, which I'm using to dictate this, so the microphone is quite adequate.

What is nice is that the microphone is on one of the wires and it is not more than three or 4 inches from your mouth. Again quite happy with the fact that it works quite well with Dragon NaturallySpeaking.

I can't see me using this for telephone calls. For some reason I don't feel comfortable with over the ear headphones, or earbuds for calls. I don't get a real sense of feedback to be able to modulate my voice. For phone calls I prefer a single ear unit.

The big disappointment is that, like so many Sony headphones I've had in the past these things are so tight, it squeezes your head like a grapefruit. What I've done is take a hairdryer to the headband to heat up the plastic, and attempt to bend it a bit to loosen it up. I've had some success in making them more comfortable. At least this plastic is somewhat malleable, because I found that some of the other plastics are almost impossible to bend without breaking.

For me they'll do the job quite well for something under $20.

After wearing them now for just a few minutes I remember what I hate about most headphones. The vinyl earpiece cover always make your ears hot.
Now I'm on the search for foam or cotton cover to go over these.
Title: They'll do the job.

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: These are some of the best headphones you can get this side of $50. Great sound, sturdy cable and connector, and very affordable. I got a pair for listening to Chopin at work and have been very happy with them. Comparing these against a set of bose on-ear headphones, the bose do have a noticeably better sound, especially if you're like me and prefer to listen to music in FLAC. Otherwise, on just mp3 these will fit the bill nicely. While these don't have noise cancelling, like the bose, they do get quite loud and don't have noticeable distortion. Lastly, while comfortable these do get uncomfortable if you're wearing them for more than 3 hours at a time. So that's you, the most comfortable headphones I've had were the bose in-ear buds due to the silicon inserts. However, those headphones died after two years because it had junky wiring and didn't hold up to getting tossed in a backpack the way these have. But at this price point, there's an incredible amount of value to these.
Title: Great Buy for the Price

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These are JUST what I was looking for: a budget set of commuter headphones. I need headphones that are closed, so as not to bother the people sitting next to me on the subway. Sound leakage on these is negligible. Thumbs up.

I need headphones that are smallish, and foldability is a plus. These are smallish and they fold easily. Another thumbs up.

They are lightweight, and feel a bit flimsy, so I would expect they will not stand up to much abuse. Luckily I have a headphone bag to keep them in when they're not on my ears or hanging around my neck.

I also wanted headphones that are not garish. These have a simple, classic and understated design that will not draw attention to themselves or look dated in a couple of years. Thumbs up.

The sound: so far, I'd say the sound is very good, especially for such inexpensive, closed phones. I'm listening to some Van Halen and the frequency range is good, with lots of punch and lots of presence. Another thumbs up.

Not sure I buy into the whole "burn-in" mantra, but I'm interested to see if they sound better in a week or two. Also curious as to how they'll handle other music styles (classical, jazz, etc).

So, first impressions: this is a GREAT set of budget commuter headphones. Superior, in my opinion, to ear-buds, which I can't stand.

EDIT: Ok, first real negative. The hard plastic headband is not comfortable after a little while. I'm going to have to superglue some padding to make them more comfortable.
Title: Great set of budget, commuter headphones!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: This is a nice cheap set of wired headphones from Sony. The do what they're supposed to do, deliver sound in to your ears from whatever device you've plugged the 3.5mm audio jack in to. I use it to listen to audio from my laptop in bed when watching Netflix/TV/etc. while my spouse watches the regular TV. They are on-the-ear headphones so they probably won't be the most comfortable to wear for long periods of listening but they work just fine for me in short stints. I like that the jack is an L-shape so it doesn't just stick right straight out from whatever device it's plugged in to.

Reviews:
The sound quality of these headphones is absolutely amazing for the low price.
I bought these for my 10 year old son as basic headphones for school and using as handsfree with a cell phone, but listening to music he and I were both amazed - these sound much better than my $100 Monster Headphones.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Despite the other reviewers hype, these are just OK headphones. I have a big head and find them tight and uncomfortable. The "natural" position for these headphones is about 1.5" apart, which means for every inch you stretch it around your head, the tighter it gets. The sound quality is muddled and has little sparkle or clarity to the highs. The bass is OK in the mid bass range, but sub bass is very poor. I won't bother to return them, for $15 bucks it's not worth it. Don't misunderstand, they are fine for the price...I understand these are not $300 headphones, but my Audio Technica's are relatively cheap too and blow these out of the water.

Title: These headphones are light and comfortable with good sound quality

Comments: 5 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
This review is based on my first impressions with the "110's" on a number of mp3 player, and a number of "100's" (the previous model https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B004WODP20/ref=oh_aui_search_detailpage?ie=UTF8&psc=1 ) that I have had and used over the years.

Pro - Sound Quality
So far I DO notice more bass in these new (my first pair of the "110's") pair of headphones and unlike prior experience with Sony (and other companies too ...) earbuds where the "new great model" .. didn't sound as good as the prior ones did ...

These 110's just add enough to the bass and possibly treble too, that makes it definitely sound better then the 100's though it doesn't fall into the trap I described above, when sometimes they add "more bass" and it turns out the bass is so strong, that it drowns everything else out. I have to say that this is not really a knock on the 100's .. I do still like them but for the same price on either ... I'd go with the 110's but if there is a "good deal" on the 100's and I was getting them again ... I am not against getting another pair of the 100's either.

Yes these are "cheap" headphones and probably not as good quality wise as a really expensive pair though I do recall some reviews saying they tried these along side a pair of "$200 Beats" and while the did say their friend's Beats did sound better ... they personally would rather get maybe two or three pair of these and still have say $150 left over ... meaning "they do not sound price-vs-quality of the sound" .. 'that much better'

Pro/Con - Build quality
These ARE plastic headphones of course, though I do not agree with those that say "oh its like they are from the Dollar store ... the plastic is horrible ..etc etc"... just if your going to buy a much more expensive pair of headphones ... your will probably get better quality too

The one downside that ... I admit I see in these, and are a problem in the pair of "the 100's" that was 100% caused by me ... AND EVEN THEN that exact pair, needed fixing but still sounds great ... I am using THEM while typing this review, is the part where the 100's and the 110's ear-cups move. I am not sure "how it could be made better" but that was the exact point of failure for my long-used pair (again 100% my fault for HOW the break,happened) .. note that if it wasn't for me they would still be fine and that is after 3+ years of HEAVY use and they still work ... so maybe it's fine for being able to fold (in both models I mean)

Pro - Fit
I am not sure if i can say one way or the other "I have a big head" (100% not a small head) but they fit fine .. even out of the box. Heck after that DIY type of repair I did on my broke pair .. .I had to flip them backwards and .. they for the most part still fit great ... these 110's are no different.

By the way I have glasses (regular and sunglasses used when wearing these) and just like the 100's, these are nice and comfy ... not too tight or too lose, if you ask me

??? - The cord
The cord looks different from the 100's I have and I like the cord ... basically I think some of the cords on others are way way too small and that always leads to the problem of one of the two sides going out for good ... The cord on the 110's looks a tad smaller diameter wise but really if that doesn't mean that issue I just described DOESN'T happen .. I do not really care... I just want the headphones to work for a long time ... if the cord is different but there are no issues ... this change is fine by me.

Plug - I will keep this review updated IF there is a change but I have no had these for long enough to comment on some of the reviews who keep having issues with the plug breaking ... NOT on this pair but my other pair of the 100's get plugged into and unplugged from stuff for over three years now and often too ... never had a problem .. but then again I cant comment on these. for now.

Summary

I would recommend these no question ... though if your expecting a super high end sound (aka are an "audiophile") you MAY BE disappointed though as someone who loves his music ... I think the sound with the right equalizer settings, on the device or program your using... I do LOVE the sound of these.

Update - After using a new pair of the "100's" ... aka the prior model

Really ... the 110's do have the slightly higher bass and that is not a bad thing either .... the new pair of the 100's I am using I actually thought were the 110's (I just forgot what headphones I was using)... THE POINT? ... they both have great bass and I think the pair that I use to wear daily (the broken pair that still works great.... just doesn't fit perfectly anymore)'s fit actually effects the bass ... that old pair I hold the earcups closer to my ears than how they "sit" now .. .and I hear alot more bass.

Between the 100s and 110's ... if the way each one of them fold doesn't matter to you for say fitting them into a caring case .... I recommend both 1000% (no typo) ... find the best deal ... if you can get one a little cheaper than the other ...cool ... there is more bass by a little bit on the 110's but do not think I am saying a new pair of the 100's are weak in that department.
Title: Nice improvement on an already good model of Sony ON ear headphones

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
My old headset has been around a while, and maybe that's what makes these feel "off." The fit is a bit on the snug side (which seems common with many headsets). The sound also seemed a bit "heavy." Maybe it's just me. After lowering the volume control a little, the sound quality improved, so perhaps I just grew accustomed to the old headset I've been using. Overall, for the price, the quality is very good. Headset cord could have been longer. I use these for gaming, so I really need to watch if I want to get up to reach for something as I don't have several feet of excess cord to work with.

* UPDATE *

Had to drop my rating to two stars. Nice headphones, but my pair had the left speaker start to fail not even a month after they arrived, and they didn't see much use. I expect better quality from Sony. :-(

Reviews: The sound quality is GOOD. The product quality is GOOD. My issue is more personal and might not be an issue for you but I find that these hurt my ears. They don't squeeze 'hard' but apparently my ears are just sensitive to ANY pressure on them. I wish I had gone for the "over the ears" version instead of the "on the ear" style these represent. If your ears aren't sensitive, the build quality and sound quality is very good and you should buy them. If your ears don't like 'pressure' on them, get the OVER the ear or IN the ear versions.
Title: Product quality is EXCELLENT; my ears just don't like the 'feel' of them

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I own several pairs of headphones and a pair of ear buds for travel. I spent a good amount of money on my travelling ear buds because I use them a lot, and I want them to sound good. For my home headphones, though, I really don't want much. I just want something that sounds clear at a low volume and will last.

None of the other pairs of headphones I have owned have lasted. They'd develop a short in the wiring somewhere, and the sound would be horrible. So far, these things have outshined any of the other "cheap" headphones I have purchased. In fact, for the price point that these things have, I would venture to use the word "amazing" to describe them, much to the chagrin of Louis CK.

These do not sound as good as my travel ear buds, but I paid five times as much for those. For $20, though, this is as good as it gets for headphones.

Title: Good quality, does the job fine.

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
This is a good set of headphones to throw around and not worry too much if I break it given its cost. The plastic headband started to weaken and spread quite a lot only after a few weeks of light use, but again, given the cost I am not too worried if I break it - but I'm knocking a star off for it. I wouldn't buy another one pair if the band breaks because I don't have a large head and the band stretching this much shouldn't happen for an average sided noggin. The stretched band also results in a looser fit which means a reduced seal with the ear that lets in ambient noise. The ear pads are comfortable despite sitting on the ears for hours some days - maybe that's due to the spread headband. The set is pretty light. The cord is on the longish side if you just use this with your cell phone.

The lows frequencies are almost nonexistent. There's just enough to let you know there's a drummer pounding the bass, but it's definitely nothing overpowering and not punchy or boomy - it's just barely there. The mids are recessed and slightly veiled and the highs are just meh - I don't think there's much reach on the high end. But really, this is nitpicking because these sound so much better than a $200 seat of Beats and an outstanding value at $15 which is what I paid for mine. I think these go as low as $10 on occasion. For the cost of a set of winter ear muffs, I have a decent set of headphones that play music well enough for mass transit commuting - and also keeps my ears warm ;)

My better set is Audio Technica's ATH-A900x which are probably on low end of the high end, but those are too unwieldy to take outside imho. So comparing these two headphones, I can easily say the set of Sony's has great price to performance ratio.

Title: As Good as Any Headphones You've Heard! Why Pay More?

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Part of the reason I am giving these headphones a five-star rating is the incredible price I got them for on amazon - $10! For just $10, these are excellent headphones! I picked up a couple pairs so that my kids can use them in the van on long car rides when they want to watch a movie on the portable DVD player. We used them over our Christmas holiday travels, and my wife has been taking them to the gym with her, too, for use with the treadmill monitor. (We both despise earbuds and consider them one of the worst inventions of the century!)

Hopefully, these will last a lot longer than the no-name discount headphones my wife purchased at the local drugstore last year. Those were more expensive than these and we had problems with those after only six months of use. Both of those have gone into the garbage can and have been replace with these Sony headphones. Definitely an upgrade!
Title: A good pair of headphones at a near unbeatable price!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I got these to replace Sony MDREX86LP in-ear earbuds, which I had for 5+ years and still sounded good, but I now found myself needing something that was not inside my ear. I need headphones that have great sound across my very eclectic music collection-- mainly classical, opera and classic rock, but occasionally some jazz, country or pop-- and are comfortable, because I listen all day while I am working. Price was also a significant consideration-- I can no longer see my way clear to paying $50+ for a set of headphones. These deliver on all accounts! The sound is rich, vocals and instruments come across very clearly and distinctly, and bass response is excellent without being overly "thumpy". The pads are comfortable on my ears for all-day listening, and these are also very lightweight. The appearance is basic, classic, and not at all flashy, so they can pass for a professional appearance at work. The cord is thick and sturdy, and the size is widely adjustable. The folding feature is neat, but these stay at the office all the time so not that important for me. I can see it being convenient for traveling. All in all, I would buy these again and again if I were to lose them or break them, and I would highly recommend them to anyone looking for an excellent set of headphones at a very decent price.
