Title: Worth Every Penny

Comments: 4 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
The Sony MDR-ZX110 stereo headphones are well worth the money: bottom line – these are nearly a match for more expensive headphones. Sony advertises a frequency range of 12-22,000 hz but does not quantify it. I made my own measurements, with an accuracy of +/- 0.5 db from 15 hz to 18,000 hz, that show these headphones provide nearly flat response, within +/- 2 db from 30 hz to 11,000 hz. Many expensive headphones do not perform as well, although their build quality and listening comfort may be better.
Evaluations are usually subjective and each person has his own hearing response function and preferences. Since I am an engineer, I like to see data. There are a number of frequency response graphs made by Headroom that you can find for reference. I have a studio-quality Sony MDR-V6 and found a chart for it by Headroom. I made my own measurements and got very good agreement with Headroom’s results, +/- 1 db. The V6 has nearly flat response, mostly within +/- 2 db from 15 hz to 11,000 hz. Sony advertises a frequency range of 5-30,000 hz. The Headroom graph also shows a sharp dip around 6000 hz. I see the dip at loud signal levels above 100 db but it nearly goes away at comfortable listening levels of 80 db or less. The Sony MDR-ZX110 has a very similar frequency response to the V6 at comfortable listening levels, but develops enhanced bass and high frequency dips and spikes at loud listening levels. At comfortable listening levels there is little difference between the two headphones. In the 25+ years since the V6 was introduced there have been a number of improvements in headphones so that an inexpensive model like the ZX110 can produce nearly comparable results.
Title: Nearly a match for more expensive headphones

They don't come with a case, which is a shame, but not the worst thing in the world. I also like that the chords don't get all tangled like iphone headphones do.

Comments: 5 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I bought these during a flash sale for $7.99. I mainly use them for listening to music on my phone and for late night gaming on a PS4 when I don't want to wake up the wife and kids.

These are a sturdy pair of headphones. Most headphones under $20 are flimsy and cheap feeling but these are very solid. I wish there was a head pad though since the plastic is a little too hard for me.

The sound quality is great for the price point. These are perfect for basic every day use. Initially I thought the sound quality was poor but it was caused by me being used to the in ear buds I've been using. Once I was accustomed to the new headphones the sound was great. Although, one thing I don't like is that these headphones are quiet. On my phone, I have to turn the volume up almost to the max. This just might be my personal preference though since I like to tune out all outside noise when listening to music.

These are not a high end pair of Bose or Beats so don't expect perfect quality. These are a great pair of solid headphones that are more than adequate for every day use. As long as you keep expectations realistic you'll thoroughly enjoy these headphones.
Title: Great Headphones For a Great Price

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I bought these primarily for my new smartphone (LG tracfone). The music quality is good and they are comfortable and quite adjustable. My complaint is with the control button. The instructions suggest the Smart Key app. The app is configurable for 1, 2 and 3 presses. For example, press once for Pause, twice for skip to next track, three times for previous track. No matter how many times I press it it only does start/pause. In addition if I am playing iHeart radio it will jump to Google Play. I have not tried the control using the phone yet.

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I bought these to replace my favorite Sony Walkman headphones, which are hard to find these days. Plus, I don't like earbuds. I use these in an office environment connected to a smart phone for listening to streaming talk radio, music and podcasts. They are comfortable and sound crisp with nice bass. The cord is thicker and more durable than what is found on other lightweight headphones. I can plug the jack into my phone without having to remove my phone case. As an added bonus, they work well at blocking out co-workers' conversations. At this price, it won't be a disaster of they got damaged or stolen. I recommend these headphones.
Title: Recommended!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
The other reviews that say you don't need to buy expensive headphones to get a good, responsive sound are spot on.

I bought these as a replacement for computer some JVC computer headphones on my work computer that fell apart after years of use.

The sound is amazing. The headphones boost the low frequencies bringing the base forward, but the upper frequencies remain clear and distinctive. Using them for playback from the Amazon Cloud Player app on my iPad, to my ears the higher frequencies while clearer than the old headphones, could have been brought forward a little bit more. However they remained exceedingly clear. This preference (again to my ears) is easily adjusted with any playback application that contains a graphic equalizer.

With or without a graphic equalizer, the Sony headphones brought out portions of the music tracks making it almost like listening to music with an upgraded quality. I actually bought a second pair for use at home.

Perhaps the more expensive headphones are worth it to audiophiles, but for the money these are by far the best headphones I have come across.

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Lightweight and compact so they're perfect for travel. I take them everywhere in my backpack. They add almost no weight and fold up nicely to stay out of the way.

They won't blow you away but the sound is sufficient for the average listener. Very clean, clear and crisp mid and highs. Bass response tends to flatten out at higher volumes, but tweaking the equalizer in my audio player overcomes that easily.

The cord is a little annoying as it is susceptible to tangling. I use a simple tie to keep the cable neat while packed away.

Overall I'm happy with the purchase. Great value for the price.

Title: Title

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
My favorite "library" headphones. I use them to listen to CDs from iTunes on my MBPR. They don't muffle out all outside sounds (so what), but they do prevent others from being bothered with my musical choices.
Excellent quality, especially at the price point. I listen to lots of newer jazz (D. Holland, D. Douglas, B. Stenson. W. Leo-Smith, W. Parker, D.S. Ware, B. Frisell) - throw in some U2, Cowboy junkies, N.Young, B. Laswell etc - NO complaints.
You can wear these for hours without notice, even with reading glasses.
At the price they are easily replaceable if lost, broken, whereas having to replace. say, a pair of HD598 CS might get me pissed off.
Title: Perfect low-cost phones for the public library...

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
The headphones do indeed do their job as expected and I am generally happy with the result. There is one warning that prevents me from giving this product five stars. It makes a lot of static noises upon first usage. This problem did naturally go away over time as I used them more and more, but it does seem like an issue that could possibly cause a customer to demand a refund if he is not willing to wait out the sound. Other than that issue, the product is great. The cord is a reasonable distance and the sound comes out nicely. It is not extremely comfortable and sort of lacks smooth adjustment maneuvers for the head size, but it gets the job done perfectly, especially for the cheap price it sells for.

I'd recommend the head set coming with a small package of the restrainers that it comes with upon opening. I'm sure I'm not the only person who treats wrapping up his headphones nicely as a big deal, but often lose the restrainer. Doing this might send a hidden message to the customer that the seller expects this thing to last a good while as long as it is taken care of.

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I needed some headphones to listen to audio books during my next business trip. Maybe I'm getting old, but I was sick of the in-ear buds that my cell phone came with, and wanted some comfort in my life. I purchased these after reading the reviews that they're comparable to the Beats headphones. I don't have a magical ear, but these sound great to me, certainly better than I'd expect $20 headphone to sound. And if you're picky enough to want the sound of $250 headphones, then go buy some $250 headphones--simple, right? I did not want to spend more that $20, and I did not want something that looked ridiculous. These feel amazing on my ears, and don't look odd on my head. I wore them for 8 hours during my plan ride, and felt great. I also like that these can be pulled off my ear and sit on my neck. In-ear buds always got caught in my purse, or fell on the floor (yuck).

Reviews: I've only had these a day now, but I can say WOW. The bass is amazing! Music on these is way richer than my MDRZX100. However, everything else seems to be drowned out on these vs the 100. TV shows feel like they have way too much bass. For music, I'd recommend the 110 to anyone but for all-around good sound, I'd have to fall back to the 100. Also, the 110's swivel is much more fragile than the 100's and I feel like it won't last long. My 100's have been dropped, kicked, stomped, and generally manhandled by my kids and they still work just as good as they did the day I bought them.
Title: Music: WOW! Everything else: eh.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
The Sony MDRZX110 stereo headphones are often lauded for their amazing sound quality, elegant design, and, most of all, stellar price. I wanted to test out these headphones to see if they were worthy of that praise, and (maybe) snap up some cheap backup headphones in the process.

These headphones sport a clean, minimal design, which I honestly appreciate. Though Beats headphones may look classy to you, I prefer the subtle, understated look Sony accomplished here. There are two models, Black and White (I chose the Black, but I was also able to have some hands-on time with my brother's White model). Each one features a matte finish on most of the body, which looks great; there is also a nice glossy portion on the backs of each "earphone" that accentuates the matte well. In terms of ports, the 3.5mm headphone jack is especially convenient, allowing you to connect straight to your phone if you'd like to kick back and listen to podcasts, movies, and, of course, music. There is another variant with a microphone built in, but I did not purchase this model and thus, I will not offer my opinion on it. Overall, build quality and design is excellent, but the top portion that sits atop your head feels a little flimsy, and though I appreciate the fact that the "earphones" fold inwards to create a compact package, I feel as though I will break them every time I try. Additionally, they're not completely comfortable, but I found that, during hours-long jam sessions, I never noticed them or had a reason to take them off and stop listening.

In terms of sound quality, Sony absolutely nailed it here. I concur with the other reviewers on this point - it's a nice, balanced sound. You get solid bass and great quality across the spectrum. I honestly think that these headphones could replace your Beats or more expensive equivalent if necessary. Sure, you won't get the complete range in crystal-clear quality and you won't feel as though you're in the recording studio (which is OK because pretty much no modern pair of headphones can achieve that), but (and this is a common theme throughout my review) for a starting price of fifteen bucks, it is a little difficult to nitpick here.

For the price, it's absolutely one of the best products I've had the pleasure of using. These Sony ZX series headphones pack a serious, bass-filled punch. They sport a modern and minimal design and sound quality is remarkable. Sure, the latest pair of top-of-the-line headphones will probably sound quite a bit better than these, and the build quality is weak in some areas, but again - consider the price and you'll be in awe of their performance. Absolute joy to use.
Title: Modern and minimal

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I had a (similar) pair of these before, so I ordered these thinking it was the same pair. I was a little surprised when I opened them and saw how small they are. The ones I had before were over the ear, not on ear, so were slightly bigger. These are fine though. They're comfortable and fit well. I gave them 4 stars because they're not very loud. I can put my music on max volume and still afford to go louder. This is my personal preference, of course, so I'm sure anyone who prefers to listen to music at normal levels won't notice.

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
For budget headphones, they are fine.

I like that they are comfortable to wear, look streamlined and reasonably attractive, and anyone can purchase these without breaking the bank.

The downfall is that the quality of the audio will never be anything more than mediocre.
There is no sharpness, no depth, no fineness that comes through. The volume doesn't reach high levels.

All in all, these are fine if you don't care to catch detail in what you listen to, and you don't need to listen at a high volume.

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I have a set of MDR-V150's that I got 6 years ago (for $15) and used basically every day since. They can take a beating but I didn't want to keep dragging them back and forth to work, so I decided to pick up another similar pair, expecting similar robustness from Sony.

The sound quality is what I expect from $16 headphones, but the design is lacking, compared to the MDR-V150:
- The folding part does not have a strong detent so it is easy to collapse, even just picking them up off a desk.
- The made the "left side indicator" (for tactile-y recognizing left-right) very small on the band, instead of on the back of the driver,
- There are no labels for increments on the adjustable size band. The MDR-V150 has numbers for reading the size of the band, these do not, no lines or anything to check size before you put it on your head.

I'll tough this out and use them, but I have my doubts that these will last long, and i definitely will look further

Title: Great product!

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I was just looking for some fairly simple headphones to drown out some of the noise at work... I didn't really need a microphone and wasn't really intending to use them with my phone, but the version with the mic was only about $5 more, and I figured it wouldn't hurt to keep my options open.

They work great for their intended purpose. I listen to an assortment of streaming music throughout the day and it sounds great. I'm no audiophile and I don't have the vocabulary to to properly express things like tone and range - but the music I'm listening to sounds good. At least as good as any other speakers or headphones I've used.

The addition of the mic is actually pretty nice, even when I'm not really using it. There's a button on the cord that (when plugged into a device that supports it) serves to mute and unmute the microphone when it's in-use... But it also serves to mute and unmute music when it's just playing music. That's additional functionality that I hadn't expected, and I'm quite happy with it.

The cable is a little bit on the short side - only about four feet long. That's more than long enough to reach my phone or computer, but both of those are sitting atop my desk. If I were trying to plug into something tucked away inside a cabinet or down on the floor I'd be having a hard time.

The headphones fold up for travel. They don't get especially compact... But simply rotating the earphones flat makes transportation much easier.

They're a little creaky. Nothing horrible... But if I move just right there's some creaking in my ears. It isn't a big issue since I'm typically using them at my desk, but I'm sure it'd be more noticeable if I were wearing them while doing something more active - running or something like that.
Title: Great headphones for the price

Title: Title

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Honestly amazing sound for the price. They shipped fast and arrived in two days thanks to Amazon Prime. The packaging is fairly plane, but adequate and doesn't really convey the quality of the sound in the headset. I have a big head (wear about a size 8 hat) and my wife has a small head (she wears an adult small helmet) and the headphones fit us both perfectly. I plugged it into our Android phones and listened to music for several hours, then into a computer and again listened to music for several hours. The sound, frequency response, and bass was impressive. I'm not usually one to listen to loud music or heavy base, but these sounded so good I couldn't take them off.

FYI, we purchased these in preparation for a long flight but I see them getting a lot of use. My son has already taken my pair, so I will be ordering more.
Title: Amazing value for the cost.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Sony MDRZX110 ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black) Seems like we never have enough sets of these headphones because everyone loves using them and I love the price!
These are inexpensive headphones with a great sound quality. The sound is very clear and detailed and the bass was surprisingly better than another brand we have.
Comfortable to wear with nice clear sound and mic that is easy to use.
We have a few pairs of these for the teens in the household to keep on hand for when they have friends over and and are playing their computer games together. One thing I like is the kids can actually hear me say something to them when they have these on.
I also like these for the kids when they travel then I do not have to worry if they break them or lose them compared to some higher end ones we have.
Title: Seems like we never have enough sets of these headphones because everyone loves them

Reviews: My grandson likes these headphones and sound good for the price. Title: Good Headphones For The Money

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: These work great as a PS4 headset. They are light and actually a little more comfortable than some of the big expensive gaming headsets. My son unplugs them from the PS4 and straight into his iPhone for music and phone calls. The multifunction button on the cord controls phone functions and the microphone picks up well. Sound quality is very good for this price level. If you need a good sounding cheap worry-free pair of headphones and not a flashy status symbol, these are for you. You can buy 10 or 12 of these for the price of one set of those colorful popular headsets. Helps avoid that sick feeling one gets when expensive headsets go missing.
Title: Great all purpose headset

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
There is a No-Mic option which is cool because I really prefer to have just the headphone. Initially, bought for the kids - the sound quality is decent and for the price, I could not complain. Sony is always a go-to brand name for good sound quality. You could probably find similar quality from competing options, but Sony doesn't typically let me down. (Meanwhile, other brands could leave some to be desired in quality, comfort-ability and value.)

After some time with the kids, they are still in-tact, so if you were worried about durability, these fit the bill. (Because you know the kids left them down for the baby to get a hold of, and they are still okay!)
Title: Another Win for Sony

I've only had they a short time but now I'm enjoying them and I'm happy I got them, especially as the price fits my budget.

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
This is where I would say ''music reproduction'' should be if
you want to begin to rate any headphone...so it is at the very
bottom of the scale....that is 1 thru 10.

Of course I have listened to other brands like Koss and
JVC which are even worse but i call those ''garbage''
since they do not even reproduce music at all that
could be considered music...just musical static....
And while knocking down is not my goal, JVC is of
course guilty of making pure junk. Shame on them.

So this Sony is at the bottom..barely able to be called
a headphone. The 199 dollar Sony's are nice. So they
do know how to do it right but choose to make inferior
quality headphones...again Shame on Sony.

Buy Sennheiser 202 for a ok budget minded sound.
Buy other Sennheiser's for an even better sound.
Buy Klipsch Image One for a great pure sound. Fair price.
Buy Beyer for a spatially awesome sound.
Buy Bose for a really nice but expensive as hell amazing sound.
Don't buy Beats because it's like a 2 pound boombox on your head.
Buy Polk if your a studio engineer.
Buy other super expensive models if your super rich.

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
The SONY ZX-Series Monitor foldable headphones maximizes your personal audio experience.

These SONY ZX-Series Monitor headphones are perfect for those on the go.

Its unique swivel, folding design collapses the unit so it can be easily stored in the smallest backpack pocket.

Listen to a rich, full-frequency sound that is usually found in Beats or Bose headphones.

Tangle-free cables resists snags so you can get caught up in your music – not your cord.

These foldable headphones include a hidden microphone – seamlessly interfacing with your smartphone.

And the best part is the price – these under-$20 foldable headphones could easily sell for 10 times the price.

Here are the benefits and advantages of these Sony foldable headphones:

– Amazing sound… especially for the super low price… delivers nice solid bass and good clean mids and highs…
– Swivel, folding design is so compact it fits in the smallest part of any backpack…
– Adjustable to fit virtually any size head…
– On-the-ear 30mm dome type headphones are surprisingly comfortable…
– Perfect length cord (almost 4 feet long)… and easily add an extender (see below)…
– Tangle-free cables…
– Tough as nails construction (with soft, cushioned material for our ears)…
– Works on any device with a 1/8″ 3.5 mm CTIA output jack (a.k.a. the “pointy” connector)…
– Employs passive noise cancelling… these foldable headphones shave 15 to 20 decibels (dB) off room noise… cuts about 30% of the noise inside a jet…
– Microphone works on any four-conductor stereo mini plug… works perfectly with Skype/Google Hangouts – even Siri and Google Voice…
– More accurate dictation than using built-in computer microphones…
– Works on any device supporting a Y-type / Plug: L-shaped stereo mini plug…
– The impedance is 24 Ω at 1 kHz.

Here are the downsides of these Sony foldable headphones:

– No in-line volume control (instead relies on device’s volume controls)…
– Too loose and bulky to use for intense workouts (or jogging).

There are a few accessories you might consider buying with the Sony MDRZX110 ZX Series Stereo Headphones:

Cosmos ® PU Leather Protection Carrying Box for LG Electronics Tone LG HBS730 / HBS-750 / HBS-760 / HBS-800 Stereo Wireless Bluetooth Headset - Black
If you are looking to protect your headphones while traveling, this Cosmos hard-shell carrying case is a great – especially as an under-$10 solution.

TRIPP LITE P318-006-MF 3.5mm Mini Stereo Audio 4 Position Headset Extension Cable
To extend the length of these headphones, a 4-pole, mini-stereo plug is needed to work with Sony’s foldable headphones with microphone.

IMPORTANT: Plug in your headphones into the extension cable BEFORE plugging the extension cable into your computer or mobile device. This helps to ensure proper hardware detection.

Sony MDRZX110 ZX Series Stereo Headphones (White)
Finally, if you prefer white foldable Sony headphones, you can order them here (but they do not include a microphone option).

DISCLAIMER:
While lots of companies want to send me free stuff to review, I always pay full price for it here on Amazon.com...

This way, I get to review the product without any pressure.

And I only review the most valuable and joyful products... because I make unboxing videos (then give them away to one lucky person - every day on my website).

I only give 4- and 5- star reviews. If a product does not make the cut, I do not review it here.

Finally, if you found my review helpful, please click "Yes."

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Very inferior to other headphone set. The sound is weak and the bass is mediocre. There are others out there that's built much better with better sound quality. One for example is the Intone I60 Lightweight Folding 3.5mm Stereo Over-ear Headphones Portable Stretch Headsets Earphones Leather Earpad with Build-in Microphone and Control Button for All Smartphones,laptops,tablets,pc,mp3/mp4,psp,ipod. It's only for a few dollars more but you'll see that the quality is there and the sound is much richer with better bass. My biggest problem I have with this Sony headphone is the built quality. It's very flimsy and just feel very cheap(well, granted it is inexpensive) but there are others out there that's better. I'm really let down by the brand Sony. The packaging is inadequate as well, a simple plastic cover over a thin cardboard and a plastic mold holding the headset. You'll see what I mean if you still decide to order one after reading this review. I really think a customer can do much better than this headphone. Don't buy it just because of brand loyalty because you'll only be disappointed. Sony is a great company with many great superior products but unfortunately this one is not one of them.

Reviews: Are you kidding me?! At this price, these are unbeatable. Folding design, distinct mellow base, and excellent sound. Compared to my daughter's Beats by Dre and the Beats have better clarity and treble and they block outside sound better, but at about 10x the cost, these are a far better value. Very enjoyable...buy a pair of these for low cost and then see how you like on ear headphones BEFORE you buy the Beats or Bose units. Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
Best sub-$25 headphones you can possibly get. The sound is even and full.

Pros:
- Cheap (price)
- Good solid bass
- Easy to drive from a phone or iPod
- Look halfway decent

Cons:
- Cheap (construction), my son has gone through like 3 pairs in the past 2 years. The plugs always wear out.
- Mediocre soundstage (for $15-$20, what are you expecting, these aren't Sennheisers)

Honestly, if you need cheap headphones for a teenager or for your second set - just get them. You won't regret it.

Reviews:

Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: These are comfortable and pretty nice sound for a basic headset. They're light and easy enough to wear for music on your walk, and they're not so fussy and expensive that you;ll worry about whether you're abusing them (like when you toss them on the couch after using them on the computer, and then your husband sits on them. No problem.)
Title: Good buy for the money

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: They're comfortable, for the price they have great sound, and I love how they fold. Unfortunately after about a year the connections from the wire to the headphone jack started to fall apart and the sound started to get staticky. A few months later I can't wear them while I'm walking at all or the sound will go out of the left ear and then the right ear every time I take a step, even when I'm sitting unless I position the cable carefully there's a decent amount of static. I used them daily, but didn't treat them roughly and I had an older pair of headphones that looked like these that lasted for years without these problems. Still for the price, I don't know if you'd expect more!
Title: For the price they're great, but they do fall apart quickly

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I had the previous version of these headphones (MDRZX100 ZX Series) for over two years, but unfortunately during one of my beast gym days I got a little cocky and the wire got stuck to one of the machines, which lead the wire to be yanked out of my phone and blow out the left speaker. I was going to order the same ones, but opted for these instead because of the mic option. My mom often calls me in the morning during my gym session, so having to take off my headphones to talk on the phone was an inconvenience and threw off my entire workout. The sound quality is excellent; once I turn my music loud, I can't hear or see anyone else. These are definitely worth the money. BEATS WHO????

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Hats off to Sony....I have speaker products from Sony including portable iPod speaker which sound amazing, in earbud wired headphones which sound amazing for $23, and now I have these over ear headphones which sound great. Between the earbud and this over ear, i must admit the earbuds are much better sounding for music. But these $20 over ear headphones are a great balance of great music sound and phenomenal phone voice quality sound. A nice touch is the ample and not to much length of the cord. Its just the right length. Thats where these earphones edge out my $23 inearbud set. Both are a great buy worth your time and every penny.
Title: Best bang for your buck and best boom for your buck too.

Comments: One person found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Sound quality is great for the price; well worth it unless you want fancy noise canceling headphones with a "status" brand label. The ear pads can get warm on your ears after awhile in a hot room, not because of any electrical issue but because of the padding. I've found this to be true for all headphones I've owned. I don't know if the expensive ones get around this problem somehow. Also, I bought these rather than earbuds because I don't like sticking loud music directly up against my ear drums. Somehow, headphones seem safer to me.
Title: Provides satsisfying sound quality at a bargain price

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
These are very good headphones for the price. I have many headphones. While I prefer having the noise cancelling feature, there are times when I don't want to have more expensive headphones with me.
These are well made, comfortable and the sound quality is very good.

I have bought these more than once for myself and to give as gifts.

I would buy them again.
Title: Very Good For The Price

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I purchased these last year based on the good reviews. It is true that the sound is amazing and they do a great job at cancelling out sound. They also fold up really nicely. However, I have to give them a 3 star review because both pairs that I bought recently quit working after only one year of use. The sound connectors seem to have loosened up. If you wiggle them and hold them in tightly they work, but not once you let go. This is disappointing considering it's a Sony product. I didn't expect amazing sound for the price, but I definitely would have expected some longevity.
Title: Great sound, but don't last long

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: Sound + design + fit = PERFECT for me:) I have always loved Sony products. It spells quality for me and I knew I will be happy with this purchase. For the price I paid, the sound may be equaled to my husband's Bose headphones. That speaks for itself. Right? Anyway, the bass is amazing and it is not deafening when you turn up the volume. Simplicity works well for me. It is not bulky nor skinny to appear cheap, and fits really well on my head. Easily adjusts and the earpieces do not hurt me at all even worn at a long period of time. Love how you could easily fold it for storage and lastly, the mic is a plus with easy function. So happy!
Title: LOVE IT!!!

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: These are good quality earphones. I use them in conjunction with a ReSound Lynx2 hearing aid. This permits me to have good quality sound and since the microphone for the hearing aid is outside the earphone capsule I can for safety reasons maintain awareness of what is going on in the gym.The speaker for the hearing aid does not completely close the ear canal so I can hear the music quite well with these earphones. The extra base helps compensate for my hearing deficiency. I amended my rating from four to five stars because this is the best resource I have found. Wireless bluetooth have short battery life. These are used in conjunction with a media player on an Android Samsumg S6. Product was delivered promptly by the Seller.

Comments: 2 people found this helpful. Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews:
I purchased Sony MDRZX110AP ZX Series Extra Bass Smartphone Headset with Mic to listen to music from my phone at work. I've owned this for about a week now, and for my intents and purposes, I love this headset. However, for my personal audio preferences, not so much.

PROS:
1. Lightweight - This headset is very light comparing to other headsets that I owned.
2. Mic - Since I connect this headset to my phone, it is useful to have the mic to also be able to answer incoming phone calls without taking my headset off.
3. Compact - The earpieces folds really nicely into a flat shape (unlike the Sony MDR7506 or Audio-Technica ATH-M50 which are still bulky even when folded).
4. $20 - It is a very cheap headset. No argument there.

CONS:
1. Sound quality - Rather than "extra bass", it feels to me more like "weak mid and high". Everything feels mumbled.
2. Comfort - I use this headset at work (which means this thing sticks on my ear for a long period of time in a day, everyday), and on-ear headsets aren't the most comfortable headset.

All things considered, this is a very low price for a headset, but if audio quality and comfort is more important to you, I'd suggest putting in an extra $4.50 for something like the Sennheiser HD 202 II (I use these personally at home for music editing, and at time of writing this review it's sold for $24.50 at Amazon). For my use at the office, however, these MDRZX110AP ZX works perfectly.
Title: Works for Its Purposes

I wanted to give these headphones a 4 or higher star rating. But the cord tangled has been such a disappointment. The sound quality is fine for the price paid for them. But the cord is tightly wound from the factory and doesn't seems to loosen or not re-tangle in a ball no matter what I try.

Comments: Was this review helpful to you?
Product: Sony MDRZX110/BLK ZX Series Stereo Headphones (Black)
Reviews: I ran across these headphones while searching for a pair of over-the-ear style, I wanted something that I could use to listen to YouTube videos 44 movies because I have A3 year old child that monopolizes the TV and I wanted the over-the-ear style to cancel out all the Disney. I'm older so I'm not trying to make a fashion statement by having a pair of $300 Dre Beats or Bose I took a chance on these because I love Sony products and the reviews, not to mention that I knew if I had any problems Amazon would let me ship them back for free with a full refund and being a Prime member just makes this even easier. Now one with the review I'm a large adult so least you're cops don't fully in case my ears like my Tony wireless headset for my PlayStation 4 does but they do cover the circumference of my ear comfortably the padding which feels like a very soft vinyl material is very comfortable they don't make my ears hot and sweaty and they do cancel outside noises as long as you have the mic on the line muted if not you'll still here outside stuff because of the inline mic which depending on how you're using them can be an advantage IE your child getting into something they shouldn't. When I first got them I plug them into my tablet fire it up a movie and I was absolutely floored with the sound quality some people say they don't go up loud enough what they do and then you know there's some programs that have sound boost and even with movies and Surround Sound with full Boost the headsets never distorted nice bass crisp treble incredible stereo like sound almost better than a movie theater you just feel like you're immersed in the movie. I've used them for phone calls and they're absolutely amazing and I've asked the other person hey can you tell I'm using a headset to talk to you and they can't tell and they can't hear my TV in the background. I plugged them into my PS4 controller and use them to game and the sound is just as good and people I chat with say that the that is perfectly clear no humming no popping no dropping and can't hear other people in the room talking. Easy to adjust they're comfortable on my large head and they fold up small for travel and I think mine came with a little bag to slide them into. In my opinion this headshot is not a one-trick pony they work great plugged into your phone to listen to music they're great plugged into a laptop or a tablet to watch movies on YouTube and I was surprised how well they work on my PlayStation 4 they just do it all and do it all well. They feel light and flimsy but they haven't broke and my three-year-old has gotten ahold of him a couple times and stretch them out and he didn't break them either which was shocking they don't have that creaky cheap plastic sound that I've seen an older model sony PlayStation headsets that costed $100+. It's only like that I would have had these in stock I would have bought them from there had them match Amazon's price and then paid the couple bucks for the 2-year Geek Squad just in case my kids would have gotten ahold of him and broke up but I got them off Amazon for only $17 they came in less than 2 days and we're going on 2 years now and they still work like brand new and my kids never broke them. I haven't loved a pair of headphones like these since I was a teenager and I used to have a Sony Walkman back in the day. Bottom line if you're looking for a nice set of over-the-ear headphones that can do everything you need them to do for under $20 these are the ones for you. I've used my friends headphones that cost over $100 and they're not any better than these. one of my friends was so impressed by these headphones that he bought them just to use with his PlayStation 4 and saved over $100 by doing this and he games every night.
Title: Awesome cans
